channel.title: Loading and saving
channel.description:
I started from the winterloves server base, And I want to know if the save thing is perfect. Like when a user logs in it says this in runserver: [code] ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:4515 LoginPacket size: 74, RSA packet size: 34 Client type: low memory version dataFileVersion[0]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[1]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[2]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[3]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[4]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[5]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[6]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[7]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[8]: 0x0 UserId: 55530012 Ident: Bryan inStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x5c521b7 inStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x4ead11 inStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3e100a1 inStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x79db2a outStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x5c521e9 outStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x4ead43 outStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3e100d3 outStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x79db5c [client-1-Bryan]: Unhandled packet [130, size=0]: [client-1-Bryan]: Loading finished. [/code] And when someone logs out: [code]BlakeScape Server: Exception! java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:92) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:136) at client.run(client.java:317) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) Game saved for player Bryan ClientHandler: Client Bryan disconnected.[/code]
They save perfectly though. But theres a weird error like that all the time. They save into a folder called saved games, as a dat file. And it doesnt save anywhere else. Any ideas what is causing that?

item.title: Loading and saving
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Im using winterloves because I want a server that doesnt lag or crash, And I want to start from nothing. I just want to know if that save way is slow, or bad, or whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading and saving
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

I started from the winterloves server base, And I want to know if the save thing is perfect. Like when a user logs in it says this in runserver:

ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:4515
LoginPacket size: 74, RSA packet size: 34
Client type: low memory version
dataFileVersion[0]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[1]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[2]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[3]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[4]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[5]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[6]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[7]: 0x0
dataFileVersion[8]: 0x0
UserId: 55530012
Ident: Bryan
inStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x5c521b7
inStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x4ead11
inStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3e100a1
inStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x79db2a
outStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x5c521e9
outStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x4ead43
outStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3e100d3
outStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x79db5c
[client-1-Bryan]: Unhandled packet [130, size=0]:
[client-1-Bryan]: Loading finished.

And when someone logs out:

BlakeScape Server: Exception! java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:92) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:136) at client.run(client.java:317) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) Game saved for player Bryan ClientHandler: Client Bryan disconnected.

They save perfectly though. But theres a weird error like that all the time. They save into a folder called saved games, as a dat file. And it doesnt save anywhere else. Any ideas what is causing that?

Read full topic
